description: From French pianiste, from Italian pianista. Analyzable as piano +â€Ž -ist.

entries.meaning: A person who plays the piano, particularly with skill or as part of an orchestra.
examples: By the time she became the world's greatest pianist, she had already practised for thousands of hours on her prized piano.

entries.meaning: (WWII) A spy using radio or wireless telegraphy to keep in touch with headquarters during the Second World War.
